query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Lo giorno se n’andava, e l’aere bruno 2 toglieva li animai che sono in terra 3 da le fatiche loro; e io sol uno
query.error: **English:** 1 The day was departing, and the dusky air 2 was taking away from animals on earth 3 their labors; and I alone
query.result: 1 Se dæg wæs agangen, and ðæt brune lyft 2 benam ða gesceaft þe on foldan sind 3 heora geswinces; and ic sylfa ana

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 m’apparecchiava a sostener la guerra 5 sì del cammino e sì de la pietate, 6 che ritrarrà la mente che non erra.
query.error: **English:** 4 was preparing myself to endure the struggle 5 of the journey and of pity, 6 which the mind that does not err will recall.
query.result: 4 me gegearwode ðæt ic ða gewinn þolode 5 ge ðæs weges ge ðære wædle, 6 ðe se ðonc ðe ne dreogeð eft gemæneð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 O muse, o alto ingegno, or m’aiutate; 8 o mente che scrivesti ciò ch’io vidi, 9 qui si parrà la tua nobilitate.
query.error: **English:** 7 O Muses, O lofty genius, now help me; 8 O memory that wrote down what I saw, 9 here your nobility will be revealed.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Io cominciai: «Poeta che mi guidi, 11 guarda la mia virtù s’ell’ è possente, 12 prima ch’a l’alto passo tu mi fidi.
query.error: **English:** 10 I began: "Poet who guide me, 11 consider my strength to see if it is sufficient, 12 before you trust me with the difficult journey."
query.result: 10 Ic ongan ða: "Þu þe me lædest, leofra frēond, 11 geseoh ðu hwæðer min mægen sy to ðære færan, 12 ær ðu me læde ofer ðone hean hrof."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Tu dici che di Silvïo il parente, 14 corruttibile ancora, ad immortale 15 secolo andò, e fu sensibilmente.
query.error: **English:** 13 You say that the son of Silvius, 14 still corruptible, went to the immortal 15 century, and was there in the flesh.
query.result: 13 ðu segst ðæt ðæs Silviuses sunu, 14 ðeah ðe he wære brosniende, to ðæm unbrosniendlican 15 worulde gewende and ðær wæs on gesewenlicum lichoman.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Però, se l’avversario d’ogne male 17 cortese i fu, pensando l’alto effetto 18 ch’uscir dovea di lui, e ’l chi e ’l quale
query.error: **English:** 16 Therefore, if the adversary of all evil 17 was courteous to him, considering the high effect 18 that was to come from him, and who and what he was,
query.result: 16 Forðæm, gif se widerwearda ealra yfla 17 wæs him arfæst, ðendende he hogode ðone hean effect 18 ðe sceolde cuman of him, and ðone hwa and ðone hwæt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 non pare indegno ad omo d’intelletto; 20 ch’e’ fu de l’alma Roma e di suo impero 21 ne l’empireo ciel per padre eletto:
query.error: **English:** 19 it does not seem unworthy to a man of intellect; 20 for he was of noble Rome and of her empire 21 chosen in the empyrean heaven as father:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 la quale e ’l quale, a voler dir lo vero, 23 fu stabilita per lo loco santo 24 u’ siede il successor del maggior Piero.
query.error: **English:** 22 who and what, to tell the truth, 23 was established by the holy place 24 where sits the successor of the greatest Peter.
query.result: 22 ða hwa and ða hwæt, to secganne ða soðan, 23 wæs gestaðelod ðurh ða halgan stowe 24 ðær sited se æftergenga ðæs mæstan Petres.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Per quest’ andata onde li dai tu vanto, 26 intese cose che furon cagione 27 di sua vittoria e del papale ammanto.
query.error: **English:** 25 For this journey, for which you give him praise, 26 he heard things that were the cause 27 of his victory and of the papal mantle.
query.result: 25 For ðære fare ðe ðu him fremest, 26 he ða ðing gehyrde ðe wæron ðære 27 his sige and ðæs papan pallium.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Andovvi poi lo Vas d’elezïone, 29 per recarne conforto a quella fede 30 ch’è principio a la via di salvazione.
query.error: **English:** 28 And then went the Vessel of Election, 29 to bring comfort to that faith 30 which is the beginning of the way of salvation.
query.result: 28 And ða gewende se Ceosena Fugel, 29 ðæt he ðære geleafan frofre gefremede, 30 ðe is anginn ðæs weg to hæle.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Ma io, perché venirvi? o chi ’l concede? 32 Io non Enëa, io non Paulo sono; 33 me degno a ciò né io né altri ’l crede.
query.error: **English:** 31 But I, why should I come there? Or who permits it? 32 I am not Aeneas, I am not Paul; 33 neither I nor anyone else believes me worthy of this.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Per che, se del venire io m’abbandono, 35 temo che la venuta non sia folle. 36 Se’ savio; intendi me’ ch’i’ non ragiono».
query.error: **English:** 34 Therefore, if I abandon myself to going, 35 I fear that the coming may not be wise. 36 You are wise; understand me, for I do not speak clearly.
query.result: 34 Forðæm, gif ic ðæs cumes me sylf begyfe, 35 ic ondræde ðæt ðæt cuma ne sie dysig. 36 ðu eart wis; ðu ongýtst me ðeah ðe ic ne secge.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 E qual è quei che disvuol ciò che volle 38 e per novi pensier cangia proposta, 39 sì che dal cominciar tutto si tolle,
query.error: **English:** 37 And just as he who changes his mind about what he wanted 38 and, because of new thoughts, changes his plan, 39 so that he completely abandons what he started,
query.result: 37 And swa swa se ðe his willan awent, 38 and ðurh niwe ðohtas his ðanc awent, 39 ðæt he ðæt ðing forlæt ðe he ær ongon,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 tal mi fec’ ïo ’n quella oscura costa, 41 perché, pensando, consumai la ’mpresa 42 che fu nel cominciar cotanto tosta.
query.error: **English:** 40 so I did on that dark hillside, 41 because, by thinking, I gave up the enterprise 42 that was so bold when I began it.
query.result: 40 ðus ic wearð on ðære dimman sæcce, 41 ðurh ðæt ic ða ðohtas ða dæd forlæt 42 ðe ic ær ongon swa deorclice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 «S’i’ ho ben la parola tua intesa», 44 rispuose del magnanimo quell’ ombra, 45 «l’anima tua è da viltade offesa;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 la qual molte fïate l’omo ingombra 47 sì che d’onrata impresa lo rivolve, 48 come falso veder bestia quand’ ombra.
query.error: **English:** 46 which often encumbers a man 47 so that it turns him away from an honorable enterprise, 48 like a false vision of a beast when it is a shadow.
query.result: 46 ðæt ðe oft gelōme ðone līg mengan 47 ðæt ðe ðonne from æðelum weorce awent, 48 swā swā unriht gesihð ðone wildeor ðonne hit sceadu bið.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Da questa tema acciò che tu ti solve, 50 dirotti perch’ io venni e quel ch’io ’ntesi 51 nel primo punto che di te mi dolve.
query.error: **English:** 49 So that you may free yourself from this fear, 50 I will tell you why I came and what I heard 51 at the first moment that I felt pity for you.
query.result: 49 Þæt ðu ðe ðisne ege forbuge, 50 ic ðe secge hwi ic com and hwæt ic ðær gehyrde 51 æt ðam forman siðe ðe ic ðinre hreowsode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 Io era tra color che son sospesi, 53 e donna mi chiamò beata e bella, 54 tal che di comandare io la richiesi.
query.error: **English:** 52 I was among those who are suspended, 53 and a lady called me blessed and beautiful, 54 so that I asked her to command me.
query.result: 52 Ic wæs on ðæm ðe syndon ahafen, 53 and ða clypode me sum wif fæger and gesælig, 54 swa ðæt ic ða bæd ðæt heo me rædan sceolde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Lucevan li occhi suoi più che la stella; 56 e cominciommi a dir soave e piana, 57 con angelica voce, in sua favella:

Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 58 "Ea, ðu arfæste Mantinisce sawl, 59 ðære lof wide geond ðas world wunað, 60 and wunað swa lange swa ðeos world standeð,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 l’amico mio, e non de la ventura, 62 ne la diserta piaggia è impedito 63 sì nel cammin, che vòlt’ è per paura;
query.error: **English:** 61 my friend, and not of fortune, 62 is hindered on the deserted shore, 63 so much on his journey that he has turned back in fear;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 e temo che non sia già sì smarrito, 65 ch’io mi sia tardi al soccorso levata, 66 per quel ch’i’ ho di lui nel cielo udito.
query.error: **English:** 64 and I fear that he may already be so lost, 65 that I may have risen too late to his aid, 66 from what I have heard of him in heaven.
query.result: 64 and ic ondræde ðæt he ne beo nu swa gedwolod, 65 ðæt ic beo to læt to ðam fultum aræred, 66 ðurh ðæt ðe ic be him on heofonum gehyrde.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Or movi, e con la tua parola ornata 68 e con ciò c’ha mestieri al suo campare, 69 l’aiuta sì ch’i’ ne sia consolata.
query.error: **English:** 67 Now move, and with your ornate speech 68 and with what is necessary for his sustenance, 69 help him so that I may be consoled by it.
query.result: 67 Nu ðu most faran and ðinre fægran spræce 68 and ðæs ðe his neod is to libbanne, 69 gefultumian ðæt ic ðæs gefrefrod sie.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Quando sarò dinanzi al segnor mio, 74 di te mi loderò sovente a lui”. 75 Tacette allora, e poi comincia’ io:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 tanto m’aggrada il tuo comandamento, 80 che l’ubidir, se già fosse, m’è tardi; 81 più non t’è uo’ ch’aprirmi il tuo talento.
query.error: **English:** 79 your command pleases me so much 80 that to obey it, if it were already possible, would be late for me; 81 I desire nothing more from you than to reveal your wish to me.
query.result: 79 swa me ðin boda byð swiðe leof, 80 ðæt ðin bebod, gif hit ðu syllan woldest, 81 ne mæg ic ðe ðæs ðances geðancian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Ma dimmi la cagion che non ti guardi 83 de lo scender qua giuso in questo centro 84 de l’ampio loco ove tornar tu ardi”.
query.error: **English:** 82 But tell me the reason why you do not protect yourself 83 from descending down here into this center 84 of the vast place to which you burn to return”.
query.result: 82 Ac sege me ðone intingan hwi du ðe ne bewerest 83 ðæt ðu ne astige her niðer on ðisne grund 84 ðæs miclan stowe ðe ðu wilnast to cymenne”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 “Da che tu vuo’ saver cotanto a dentro, 86 dirotti brievemente”, mi rispuose, 87 “perch’ i’ non temo di venir qua entro.
query.error: **English:** 85 “Since you want to know so deeply, 86 I will tell you briefly,” he replied to me, 87 “because I do not fear coming in here.
query.result: 85 “Nu ðu wilt witan swa deoplice, 86 ic ðe sceal secgan sceortlice,” he me andswarode, 87 “forðæm ic ne ondræde ðe her in to cumenne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Temer si dee di sole quelle cose 89 c’hanno potenza di fare altrui male; 90 de l’altre no, ché non son paurose.
query.error: **English:** 88 One should only fear those things 89 that have the power to harm others; 90 not the others, for they are not fearsome.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 I’ son fatta da Dio, sua mercé, tale, 92 che la vostra miseria non mi tange, 93 né fiamma d’esto ’ncendio non m’assale.
query.error: **English:** 91 I have been made by God, through his mercy, such 92 that your misery does not touch me, 93 nor does the flame of this fire assail me.
query.result: 91 Ic eom geworden fram Gode, ðurh his mildse, swylc, 92 ðæt ðin earmðu ne hrepð me nænigu, 93 ne ðæs lig egesan ðisne ne geswencð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Donna è gentil nel ciel che si compiange 95 di questo ’mpedimento ov’ io ti mando, 96 sì che duro giudicio là sù frange.
query.error: **English:** 94 A gentle lady in Heaven grieves 95 over this hindrance to which I send you, 96 so that harsh judgment up there is broken.
query.result: 94 Wif is on heofonum ðe ðisne hreoh 95 ðurh ðisne gesceaft bemeornað, 96 ðæt ðær ðone heardan dom forðbreceð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Questa chiese Lucia in suo dimando 98 e disse:—Or ha bisogno il tuo fedele 99 di te, e io a te lo raccomando—.
query.error: **English:** 97 This Lucia asked in her request 98 and said: "Now your faithful one has need 99 of you, and I commend him to you."
query.result: 97 Þis Lucię bæd on hire bene 98 and cwæð: "Nu ðin leofa ðearfe hæfð 99 ðinre, and ic hine ðe bebeode."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Lucia, nimica di ciascun crudele, 101 si mosse, e venne al loco dov’ i’ era, 102 che mi sedea con l’antica Rachele.
query.error: **English:** 100 Lucia, enemy of every cruelty, 101 moved, and came to the place where I was, 102 where I sat with the ancient Rachel.
query.result: 100 Lucia, feond ðæs cræftan cræftes, 101 heo hire ongon ða stigan, and ðær heo ða gestod, 102 ðær ic sæt mid ðære ealdan Rachele.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Disse:—Beatrice, loda di Dio vera, 104 ché non soccorri quei che t’amò tanto, 105 ch’uscì per te de la volgare schiera?
query.error: **English:** 103 She said: "Beatrice, true praise of God, 104 why do you not help the one who loved you so much, 105 that he left the common crowd for you?
query.result: 103 Cwæð:—Beatrice, lóf Godes sóðe, 104 hví ne gehelpeð ðú ðæm ðe ðe lufode swíðe, 105 ðe for ðe út eode of ðære folcsceare?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Non odi tu la pieta del suo pianto, 107 non vedi tu la morte che ’l combatte 108 su la fiumana ove ’l mar non ha vanto?—.
query.error: **English:** 106 Do you not hear the pity of his weeping, 107 do you not see the death that fights him 108 on the river where the sea has no power?"
query.result: 106 Ne gehyrst ðú ðæs weopes hryre, 107 ne gesyhst ðú ðone deað ðe hine winneð 108 ofer ðære ea ðær se sæ næfð geweald?—.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 Al mondo non fur mai persone ratte 110 a far lor pro o a fuggir lor danno, 111 com’ io, dopo cotai parole fatte,
query.error: **English:** 109 In the world there never were people so quick 110 to do their good or to flee from their harm, 111 as I, after such words were spoken,
query.result: 109 On worulde næfre wæron men swa hræde 110 to donne heora frofre oððe fleonne heora hryre, 111 swa ic, æfter ðam wordum ðe ðu geworht hæfst,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 venni qua giù del mio beato scanno, 113 fidandomi del tuo parlare onesto, 114 ch’onora te e quei ch’udito l’hanno”.
query.error: **English:** 112 came down here from my blessed seat, 113 trusting in your honest speech, 114 which honors you and those who have heard it.
query.result: 112 com her niðer of minum beorhtan stole, 113 truwiende ðinum wordum ðe ðu geworht hæfst, 114 ðe nu wurðiað ðe and ða ðe ða gehyrdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Poscia che m’ebbe ragionato questo, 116 li occhi lucenti lagrimando volse, 117 per che mi fece del venir più presto.
query.error: **English:** 115 After he had spoken thus to me, 116 he turned his shining eyes, weeping, 117 so that he made me come more quickly.
query.result: 115 Þa he ðis to me sæde, 116 his eagum leohte wepende gewende, 117 swa ðæt he me to ðam siðe selran macode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 E venni a te così com’ ella volse: 119 d’inanzi a quella fiera ti levai 120 che del bel monte il corto andar ti tolse.
query.error: **English:** 118 And I came to you just as she wished: 119 you rose up before that beast 120 that kept you from the short journey up the fair mountain.
query.result: 118 And ic com to ðe swa swa heo wolde: 119 ðu ðe aræerest ðære fyrenan, 120 ðe ðe ðæs fægran muntes sceortne sið beneom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Dunque: che è? perché, perché restai, 122 perché tanta viltà nel core allette, 123 perché ardire e franchezza non hai,
query.error: **English:** 121 So then: what is it? Why, why did you remain, 122 why do you foster such cowardice in your heart, 123 why do you have no boldness and courage,
query.result: 121 Þonne: hwæt is ðæt? Hwi, hwi ðu ðær wune, 122 hwi ðu on ðinum breostum ðone unræd lætst, 123 hwi ðu ðone ellen and ðone ofermægen næfst,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 poscia che tai tre donne benedette 125 curan di te ne la corte del cielo, 126 e ’l mio parlar tanto ben ti promette?».
query.error: **English:** 124 since three such blessed ladies 125 care for you in the court of heaven, 126 and my words promise you such good things?”.
query.result: 124 siððan ðe ða ðreo gesæligan ðegnunge 125 on heofona rice reccað, 126 and ðin spræc ðe swylcne from hafað?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 Quali fioretti dal notturno gelo 128 chinati e chiusi, poi che ’l sol li ’mbianca, 129 si drizzan tutti aperti in loro stelo,
query.error: **English:** 127 Like little flowers which, bowed down and closed 128 by the chill of night, after the sun whitens them, 129 all open on their stems,
query.result: 127 Swa ða blostman be nihtes cele 128 bið gehnægð and belocen, ðonne sunne hine bled, 129 ahebbað hi ða heafdu on heora stelum,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 tal mi fec’ io di mia virtude stanca, 131 e tanto buono ardire al cor mi corse, 132 ch’i’ cominciai come persona franca:
query.error: **English:** 130 so I made myself of my weary virtue, 131 and so much good boldness ran to my heart 132 that I began like a person who is free:
query.result: 130 swa ic ða dyde of minre wædle mode, 131 and swa micel gleawnes ða to heortan com, 132 ðæt ic ða ongan swa freolic man:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
133 «Oh pietosa colei che mi soccorse! 134 e te cortese ch’ubidisti tosto 135 a le vere parole che ti porse!
query.error: **English:** 133 “O compassionate one who helped me! 134 And you, courteous one, who promptly obeyed 135 the true words that she spoke to you!
query.result: 133 “Eala ðu milde ðe me ðus gefrefrode! 134 And ðu ðe ða hraðe ðinum hlaforde gehyrsumodest, 135 ða soðan word ðe he ðe sæde!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
136 Tu m’hai con disiderio il cor disposto 137 sì al venir con le parole tue, 138 ch’i’ son tornato nel primo proposto.
query.error: **English:** 136 You have disposed my heart with desire 137 to come with your words, 138 so that I have returned to my first intention.
query.result: 136 ðu hafast ðurh ðinne spræce ðone hyge min 137 ðurh ða wilnunga to ðam wege awend, 138 ðæt ic eom nu eft on ðam forman geþance.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
139 Or va, ch’un sol volere è d’ambedue: 140 tu duca, tu segnore e tu maestro». 141 Così li dissi; e poi che mosso fue,
query.error: **English:** 139 Now go, for a single will is in both of us: 140 you as leader, lord, and master." 141 Thus I said to him; and after he had moved,
query.result: 139 Nu ga, for ðæt an willa is on us begen: 140 ðu heretoga, ðu hlaford and ðu lareow. 141 Ic ðus cwæð; and siððan he afaren wæs,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
142 intrai per lo cammino alto e silvestro.
query.error: **English:** 142 I entered the high and wild path.
query.result: 142 ic eode on ðone hean and wudufæstan weg.
